page.title: 06BOAT BUILDING ON SCORAIG
page.content: ON SCORAIG THERE IS A BOAT BUILDER. HE BUILDS ABOUT 3 TO 4 BOATS A YEAR. MOST OF THE BOATS HE BUILDS ARE COPIES OF OTHER BOATS,WHICH HE FIRST HAS TO MEASURE VERY CAREFULLY.NEXT HE MAKES A FRAME ON WHICH TO BUILD UP THE PLANKS. THEN HE STEAMS THE PLANKS TO MAKE THEM BEND.THEY NEED TO BEND BECAUSE IF THEY DID NOT BEND THE BOAT WOULD LOOK LIKE A BOX.SOMETIMES THE PLANKS ARE BENT ANYWAY.HE BANGS THE PLANKS TOGETHER WITH COPPER AND GALVANISED NAILS.THIS IS CALLED CLINCHING,SO THE BOATS ARE CALLED CLINKER-BUILT. WHEN THE BOATS NEED TO BE PAINTED HE USUALLY EMPLOYS SOMEONE TO DO IT.ON A Â£1000 BOAT,ABOUT Â£250 IS SPENT ON MATERIALS AND OVERHEADS.IT TAKES ABOUT 200HOURS TO BUILD A BOAT,SO HE MAKES ABOUT Â£4 AN HOUR.HE ALSO BUILDS WHEEL- HOUSES FOR LARGER FISHING BOATS.
